snippet: A power device used in the procedure called morcellation can scatter bits of fibroid tissue or undetected cancer cells around the abdomen.
abstract: Articles in The Journal of the American Medical Assn say power device used by doctors in the uterine surgical procedure called morcellation, which is performed on tens of thousands of women annually in the United States, can scatter bits of fibroid tissue or undetected cancer cells around the abdomen.
lead_paragraph: A power device used in the procedure called morcellation can scatter bits of fibroid tissue or undetected cancer cells around the abdomen.

headline.main: Uterine Surgical Technique Is Linked to Abnormal Growths and Cancer Spread
headline.print_headline: Uterine Surgical Technique Is Linked to Abnormal Growths and Cancer Spread

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations
